Text: Keep going forward—looks like this is our only option.
It seems like you'll have to get through the crucial Kuroro from the right to reach the endpoint...
A Kuroro will run in the opposite direction if either a Construct shows up around it or another character is eliminated.
It doesn't seem like you'll be able to make it to the endpoint going down. Is there a way to move the crucial Kuroro downward, though...
Can you somehow push the crucial Kuroro to the left so it moves in sync with the patrolman...?
Why don't you try approaching it from the side with Tai'E's help since you can't get close to it from below?
And Tai'E only shows up on odd rounds, eh... I see what you're saying. We definitely can't miss this opportunity.
You can make it straight to the endpoint if You can push the Kuroro on the right to the top.
If you want to push Kuroro upward to make it a stepping stone, you'll need to take advantage of the fact that it runs away when it gets scared.
It seems like you can keep moving and change location and direction if you move close to Tai'E from the side.
I have a bad feeling about these pools. You just might be able to make your way through them if you can freeze them.
Kuroros will run away in fear, too, if the character around its fall into the water.
There is water all around the Kuroro at the bottom. Maybe we don't need to make our hands dirty at all, Commandant.
You can probably use the Kuroro in the upper-right corner. Keep it safe until you're done using it.
It seems like there is no way you'll ever be able to reach the Kuroro up there... Guess you'll need a few extra hands.
After spotting an abnormal occurrence in its sight, the Roseblade will move to where it took place in the next round.
Roseblade won't stop in front of the pool. If only you can move it forward...
Is there a way we can move the Kuroro in the middle down to the bottom...?
You need to catch the stepping stone with another stone so it won't fall into the water.
The butler won't come down for you if you don't knock on the door.
Be careful. The Kuroro carries fire with it, and fire will melt ice...
The Kuroro has decided to burn through the ice. You'll have to go around to get close to it, then.
If you stand on the green mark, all the stone gates with the same mark will drop down.
You need someone to keep these stone gates from going back up so you can get close to the Kuroro in the bottom-left corner...
Let's burn the grass first. The path that appeared doesn't seem like a difficult walk at all.
The Kuroro at the bottom is wrapped up in ice under the bushes. Try to get close to it from the side.
There are quite a few pools on the field, and the Kuroro is an Ice Kuroro. I wonder if we can somehow get its help...
You'll need to come up with a way to burn down the grass that's blocking its way before luring out Roseblade.
Now, imagine for a second that the Kuroro up there is all alone by itself...
Move up the Fire Kuroro at the bottom so it can work with the Kuroro on the right.
The Lightning Circle pulls in all the characters and Kuroros that carry Lightning Attribute with them.
Use Lightning Circle
Pushing Kuroros into the water seems to come with more benefits than one.
If you can somehow keep the Kuroro from moving away from the Lightning Circle on the right...
Now, both Kuroros carry Lightning Attribute with them—which doesn't just happen for no reason. It has to be a hint.
Move to the right from the get-go and let miracles happen.
Lightning Attribute still works even when it's carried by a Kuroro.
Push the Kuroro to the right and make the grass grow so you can land on it.
You need to clear the path up to the endpoint with Roseblade. Try to block its way with the grass.
Head to the right and block Tai'E clockwise. The endpoint is right there.
You don't have another choice... Need I say more, Commandant?
It teleports everything—even Kuroros, yes. Chase it down and make it your stepping stone.
Let's familiarize ourselves with it: Teleport it into the mist and follow it.
The mist has multiple entrances and exits, so best of luck choosing the right path.
To start with, you can try getting rid of the elemental Kuroros, Commandant.
Hold off on changing direction when you're done eliminating the Kuroro at the bottom. See, there is a crypt below the Lightning Circle.
Try destroying the Lightning Circle on the left, Commandant. The Kuroro will take care of the rest.
Try to make the Kuroro on the left fall into the water, then approach the crucial Kuroro using Teleporting Mist.
It seems like you'll have to make a round.
It doesn't seem like you can make it straight to the endpoint... You'll have to catch the Kuroros that fall and make them into a wall to catch yourself with.
Keep going forward—looks like this is our only option.
Changing your direction immediately after you stop doesn't seem to work here.
I see... A Kukuro will run in the opposite direction whenever a Construct shows up near it.
And it seems like they get scared and run away, too, when enemies around them are eliminated.
If you could push the upper-right Kuroro up...
It will be easier if we can patch the opening on the left.
Watch out, Commandant. That red circle shows Shark-speare's detection range.
The walls in front of the endpoint are pretty smooth. How do I make it to the other side...?
Look carefully. There are only two paths leading to the endpoint. If you can take one of them...
Tai'E moves along a fixed route in each turn... And anything with a predictable pattern can be exploited.
You will also be able to control the shadows, but they won't scare Kuroro off or eliminate them.
Hmm... Is there a way to get pass the walls and get to the area below?
It seems there is only one entrance to the area below.
Those holes look dangerous... Remember to avoid them.
Kuroro will be scared and run if someone falls into a trap hole.
You have to sacrifice your own shadow when necessary.
It seems better to reach the Kuroro on the left edge from above or right.
The key is to get back to the area above from below and reach the endpoint.
On the bright side, with the detection range and traps around, we're bound to steer clear of some of the wrong paths.
The endpoint and Shark-speare are surrounded by walls. Is there anything we can use as a stepping stone...?
The Electro-Walls are electrified, so be careful not to bump into them. Step on the switch to turn them off.
You don't always need to get your hands dirty to get what you want.
One and only objective: Turn off the switch.
You don't have to push every single button, Commandant. Stay focused.
There is only one entrance at the endpoint. How can we get there...?
Turn off the switch before using the Kuroro as stepping stones, otherwise, they will be eliminated by the Electro-Walls.
We have to find a stepping stone to reach the endpoint after eliminating the Kuroro in the upper-left corner...
Don't be scared by the Electro-Walls, Commandant. Those are just paper tigers.
Try to finish the battle in the middle of the battlefield. Don't let Kuroro escape to the right side.
Sometimes you need to move more than once to get Kuroro to the place where it needs to be.
I know it's hard but please keep me safe, Commandant.
Watch out for the trap hole on the right. Even I don't want to fall into it.
Try to kill Shark-speare first.
Get the Kuroro above down and use it as a stepping stone, not me.
Sometimes you have to take the longer path to make the best use of your stepping stone, Commandant.
You want to evacuate people who shouldn't be there before starting a hunt.
Don't fight Kuroro the second you enter the battle. Take a walk around it first.
You only have a few ways to reach the key Kuroro. Moving from left to right could be a good idea.
You could use the help of Celica when necessary, Commandant.
...I can also be your assistant if necessary, Commandant.
After spotting an abnormal occurrence in its sight, the Roseblade will move to where it took place in the next round.
Distract the Roseblade and don't look back no matter what is blocking your way.
You could use the help of your allies, including me, when necessary, Commandant.
Enemies that will only move under certain conditions are just moving stepping stones.
You have to stop the Kuroro on the left to reach the Kuroro on the right.
Use the Roseblade as your stepping stone, Commandant.
You can never have too many stepping stones. Get yourself two stepping stones if one is not enough.
Places that are hard to reach won't be a big deal when you have the help of the stepping stones.
I've seen a complete letter S. You are on its tail, Commandant.
The Roseblade here won't stay very long. You need to make him stay somewhere.
Keep going forward—looks like this is our only option.
Think about it... If Kuroro on the left wasn't there...
Changing your direction immediately after you stop doesn't seem to work here.
I see... A Kukuro will run in the opposite direction whenever a Construct shows up near it.
It's a bit far... But there must be a way to approach the Kuroro up top.
The Kuroro on the right cannot be eliminated directly, but if you use that...
Make good use of your enemies, Commandant.
Instead of eliminating each enemy, maybe you can use them to your advantage.
Watch out, Commandant. That red circle shows Shark-speare's detection range.
The area outside the red circle is Shark-speare's blind spot. Time to strike now!
The enemies on the top side are impossible to break through... Why not turn to the ones on the bottom?
"Move along a fixed route in each turn"... Indeed, the more regular of a routine, the easier it is to spot a fatal flaw.
Sometimes it's not bad to take a detour...
Only if you can lure the Kuroro to the bottom left corner... But how?
That patrolman was just bluffing. Don't let him get away, Commandant!
There are two Kuroro... You have to think carefully about which one should be dealt with first.
There's only one way for sure, right, Commandant?
Let's ignore the Kuroro on your left for now.
Looks like they're going in different directions. If we choose the right one...
If you're finding it difficult... Why not take a look at the Kuroro on the right?
It's not difficult to predict their next move based on their movement pattern. Go right first, Commandant.
The patrolman and stone gate are in line with each other. If we can trap him...
Looks like... Now's the time to take down all the enemies at once.
The Kuroro up top can't be taken out from here, but if you can use that...
...I'm sure you're aware that you've only got one choice.
Please keep in mind that a new path might form when the terrain changes, Commandant.
...It's a dead end? Well then, we'll just have to make them clear the way!
The top one seems to be a decoy... Wanna know how I know that? My intuition!
Let's eliminate the enemies on the bottom first, Commandant.
It's fine to let your enemies run for a while... And please remember to count your steps.
The terrain toward the top is complicated. Don't let your enemies get there, Commandant.
It's not always bad to take a detour... Hmm? Is that an infinity symbol?
There's only one way ahead. Let's go!
The key is to keep moving after the shadow kills the key Kuroro.
A Kuroro will run in the opposite direction if either a Construct shows up around it or another character is eliminated.
Use two ordinary Kuroros to help you to reach the destination first and save the bunny for last.
When you or your shadow reaches the magic circle, the one who has reached it will stop and wait for the other one to act. Then, the two of you will swap positions.
It seems there's only one exit in the lower right area... We have to step on something to get out, don't we?
It seems we have to drive the Kuroro down there to the left side of the map to get to the destination...
Once you or your shadow enters Shark-speare's range of attack, the one who enters it will be killed by Shark-speare.
Don't touch the Electro-Walls when they are powered on. Step on the switch to turn them off.
Drive the Kuroro on the left to the electric net to shock another Kuroro and cover up Shark-speare's range of attack.
You can burn the grass. There is only one way. Let's go.
Perhaps the grass is just an ornament. Kill the key Kuroro directly and move to the destination. Your shadow will clear the way for you.
Your shadow can make the grass grow, while you can burn grass that is connected together. Set Kuroro free to get to the destination!
Burn the grass to save the shadow. Let it kill the Kuroro up there and then move to the destination with it!
Crack the mechanism to let yourself move to the destination. Use the spikes to keep yourself ahead of your shadow!
Turn off the electro-wall switch to keep your shadow safe and then move to the center together!
Turn on the switch to make your shadow move to the right side to kill Kuroro together! And then try to touch the stone gate on the right side to get back!
Get through the magic circle so that you and your shadow can act separately!
What's under the grass on the left? Is it a mechanism? Touch it and walk along the edges of the map!
Watch where you are and then use the grass grown by your shadow to stop yourself from sprinting. You might be safe when your shadow reaches the stone gate switch!
Physical elements can push the bubble one step ahead, while ice elements will break it.
Try again! Push the bubble and let your shadow use t to open a path for you.
Move the bubble to a proper position to make your shadow break it.
Those holes look dangerous... Remember to avoid them.
Let your shadow move to the left and swap your positions when time's right. Believe me, this is a necessary sacrifice.
Move to the right immediately at the beginning and swap positions. To let your shadow break the bubble, we have to make more use of the Swapping Circles.
Think of a way to get the bubble in the key Kuroro's way to avoid it from going into the trap!
It looks like we have to move the bubble first and then use the key Kuroro to reach the destination.
Drive the key Kuroro down, and then... If there's a way to make the two Kuroros down there our stepping stones...
Drive the Kuroro up there down and then take the advantage of Kuroro's scare mechanism to make both Kuroros reach the correct positions.
Let your shadow rush to the destination!
Hold your horses and let your shadow go first.
Move along the pool and try to meet with your shadow.
Move right across the warning line so you can kill Kuroro.
Meet with your shadow first and then let it hunt Kuroro down.
Order your shadow to show the Roseblades on both sides what it can do! Patrol one more round and you'll find the way out.
Take care of Tai'E and then switch positions.
Swap positions twice and you'll reach the destination directly.
Take a detour to switch positions. Then, go through the pool and switch again.
Order the shadow in the top right corner to move around and try to switch positions with it.
Use the steel plate to scare Kuroro away and move to the destination!
The destination is right ahead... Touch the wall and turn around!
Scare away Kuroro and kill it! Then use the steel plate to reach the destination! Does that mean that those mechanisms are simply distractions...?
Use your shadow to kill all the Kuroros. Then, use the Swapping Circles to swap positions to reach the destination.
Perhaps you can use the spikes to move to the upper area of the map. Use the steel plate to reach the stone gate switch!
The steel plates make it hard for you to move around. Can we try with the shadow? But it seems that the shadow can't stay on the steel plate for too long...
Keep trying! Keep circling! Get yourself closer to the bottom gradually...
The spikes can make you stop at the exit of the stone gate. Use the shadow on the right side to open a path!
Dead end! Move yourself to the steel plate and then start over!
Order your shadow to kill Kuroro and use the steel plate to keep yourself somewhere you can get back to the stone gate switch.
到不了终点的话，利用藤球垫脚试试。
到不了终点的话，利用藤球垫脚试试。
怪物挡路，利用藤球击杀它们！
利用草圃的反弹效果来到达你想去位置。
利用草圃的反弹效果来到达你想去位置。
先利用藤球垫脚击杀库洛洛，再回来处理其他怪物吧。
利用火属性点燃草圃，清空障碍物吧。
利用火属性点燃怪物，清除障碍。
藤球进入水中可以变成草圃，再用火属性清除草圃吧。
下面走不通的话，再看看有没有其他通路呢？
正面走不通，试试利用藤球进水的效果。
利用藤球变草圃的机制来清除水池吧。
换个属性就能清除障碍物！
藤球往往可以当成炮弹！
换个属性就能解决很多障碍。
试试利用点燃的藤球触发怪物的点燃连锁！
如果当前属性无法通过，不如试试回头换换属性。
下面的障碍不好清理，试试从上面走呢？
指挥影子击杀怪物。
指挥影子来处理掉挡住本体的障碍吧。
冰面很危险，不要让影子停在冰面上！
影子走过的冰面就会成为阻挡影子的障碍！
影子和本体的困难可能在对方眼里根本不算困难！
灵活利用换位，让本体到达终点。
